claim_text: Drinking hot water or warm beverages can cure or prevent COVID-19 infection
summary: Hot water does not cure or prevent COVID-19. While staying hydrated is important for overall health, there is no scientific evidence that drinking hot water kills the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The virus spreads primarily through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces. Proven preventive measures include vaccination, wearing masks, hand hygiene, and physical distancing.

evidence.title: Infection prevention and control in the context of COVID-19
